channel.title: For Vs While
channel.description:
I've been doing tests to see which one is faster.I've tested each way 3 times and i've also done reversing the increments.What i mean when i said i reversed the incerments was i changed [code]number--[/code] to [code]--number[/code]
after i did each one 3 times i average my results.I know they're 2 different things comparing,But i'm taking about using it for arrays and things like that.
Results: [code] for(int number = 1000;number > 0; number--) 1.74 2.52 3.51
Average : 59
for(int number = 1000;number > 0; --number)
1.48 2.46 3.51
Average : 48
while(number !=0) - number--
1.52 2.51 3.58
Average : 53
while(number !=0) - --number
1.57 2.56 3.45
Average : 52 [/code]
anyone wanna dicuss why these results seem mostly go down on each run? or discuss the results or comparisons at all?

item.title: For Vs While
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Acquired immune deficiency syndrome or acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS or Aids) is a collection of symptoms and infections resulting from the specific damage to the immune system caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) in humans, and similar viruses in other species

Read full topic

item.title: For Vs While
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“k00dr, post:3, topic:224413”][code]
private final static void testFor() {
for(int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
continue;
}
}

private final static void testWhile() {
int i = 0;
while(i < 100) {
i++;
continue;
}
}
[/code]

->

[code]
private static final void testFor();
Code:
0: iconst_0
1: istore_0
2: iload_0
3: bipush 100
5: if_icmpge 14
8: iinc 0, 1
11: goto 2
14: return

private static final void testWhile();
Code:
0: iconst_0
1: istore_0
2: iload_0
3: bipush 100
5: if_icmpge 14
8: iinc 0, 1
11: goto 2
14: return

}
[/code][/quote]haha

Read full topic

item.title: For Vs While
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

  private final static void testFor() {
    for(int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
      continue;
    }
  }

  private final static void testWhile() {
    int i = 0;
    while(i < 100) {
      i++;
      continue;
    }
  }

->

private static final void testFor();
  Code:
   0:   iconst_0
   1:   istore_0
   2:   iload_0
   3:   bipush  100
   5:   if_icmpge       14
   8:   iinc    0, 1
   11:  goto    2
   14:  return

private static final void testWhile();
  Code:
   0:   iconst_0
   1:   istore_0
   2:   iload_0
   3:   bipush  100
   5:   if_icmpge       14
   8:   iinc    0, 1
   11:  goto    2
   14:  return

}

Read full topic
